result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy C Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $1000.00 including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid form bail on deposit. No DNA surcharge due to low income.

12-09-15/ Judge John Siefert
The defendant's request for release privileges is granted.
Defendant may be released for the following:  Electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence. No Huber. If defendant provides court with proof of community service, Court will allow sentence to be served on ES.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy C Allen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 12-09-15 Court order granting release for Electronic Monitoring
Defense reqeust for release privileges to include electronic monitoring is granted by the  Court. Copies forwarded to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. mag

Defendant Timothy C Allen in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Fine of $1000.00  including  all mandatory  costs, fees and surchares to be paid from bail on deposit. No DNA surcharge due to low income. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 10 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 day time served. No  Huber privileges . Court stayed the commencment until 12-30-15. If defendant provides court will proof of community service , Court will allow sentence to be served on ES. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Timothy C Allen in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court set bail in the amount of $1000.00 cash which can be posted out of custody at the clerk of courts office.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM046162  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
10/15/2015

Defendant Timothy C Allen in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
Case passed for defendant to obtained bail money.

Defendant Timothy C Allen in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Havas.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Siefert, Br. 47.  Court vacates jury trial date of 10-19-2015.  Status conference scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy C Allen in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  
Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy C Allen in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for status conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Parties are notified that effective June 8, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Reserve Judge, Branch 45 in Courthouse room 515.  Case adjourned to Br 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-29-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dionicio N. or the residence or place of employment

Defendant Timothy C Allen in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 46.vb
